references.paper_title: Nonparametric empirical Bayes and compound decision approaches to estimation of a high-dimensional vector of normal means
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the theoretical framework of the current paper, particularly regarding the challenges and approaches to variance estimation in high-dimensional settings.

references.paper_title: Minimax estimation of the noise level and of the deconvolution density in a semiparametric convolution model
references.reason: This paper provides crucial insights into the minimax rates of variance estimation in semiparametric convolution models, which are closely related to the compound decision setting discussed in the current paper.

references.paper_title: General maximum likelihood empirical Bayes estimation of normal means
references.reason: This paper offers a comprehensive overview of maximum likelihood empirical Bayes methods for estimating normal means, a critical component of compound decision theory and highly relevant to the current work.

references.paper_title: Optimal estimation of Gaussian mixtures via denoised method of moments
references.reason: This paper provides important insights into the optimal rates of Gaussian mixture estimation and a related moment-based approach, which are directly relevant to the variance estimation problem tackled in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Estimating Learnability in the Sublinear Data Regime
references.reason: This paper explores variance estimation in high-dimensional linear regression, demonstrating that rate-optimal methods often leverage cumulants, which offers valuable insights for extending such techniques to compound decision settings
